 I'm using the LA1816 (bdent.com), it needs only the oscillator coil, a 45=
5khz ceramic filter, and  a choke I wind by hand for AM, and pretty much th=
e same for FM. I add an AM RF amp so I can use a wire antenna. If you can w=
ork with SMT compnents, I have a layout all done. I order the boards from E=
xpress PCB for about $93 for two (min order), and if you want the silk scre=
en on the board, that doubles the cost. There are some mistakes/changes to =
the current schematics that have been posted out on the net, I have up date=
s, but they are at work, and I can't post it from there, I keep forgetting =
to bring them home.   FM leaves something to be desired, but I'm rearrangin=
g the two FM coils on the latest board layout to see if that helps.  The co=
mponent values are marked for the top side with the silk screen, but there'=
s no way to label the bottom from Express PCB. There's some jumpers needed,=
 and I think I have them all labeled. You will have to down load the softwa=
re from Express PCB to see the layout http://www.expresspcb.com/
 
 Getting=
 the board is the easy part, assembly and wiring, that takes some time!
 
 =
Frank-S

 I'm using the LA1816 (bdent.com), it needs only the oscil=
lator coil, a 455khz ceramic filter, and  a choke I wind by hand&=
nbsp;for AM, and pretty much the same for FM. I add an AM RF amp so I can u=
se a wire antenna. If you can work with SMT compnents, I have a layout=
 all done. I order the boards from Express PCB for about $93 for =
two (min order), and if you want the silk screen on the board, that doubles=
 the cost. There are some mistakes/changes to the current schematics that h=
ave been posted out on the net, I have up dates, but they are at work, and =
I can't post it from there, I keep forgetting to bring them home. <BR>&nbsp=
;<BR> FM leaves something to be desired, but I'm rearranging the two F=
M coils on the latest board layout to see if that helps.<BR> <BR>&nbsp=
;The component values are marked for the top side with the silk screen, but=
 there's no way to label the bottom from Express PCB. There's some jumpers =
needed, and I think I have them all labeled. You will have to down load the=
 software from Express PCB to see the layout <A href=3D"http://www.expressp=
cb.com/">http://www.expresspcb.com/</A><BR>
 <BR>
 Getting the bo=
ard is the easy part, assembly and wiring, that takes some time!<BR>
 =
<BR>
 Frank-S<BR><BR><BR><BR>
